intro: Tissa teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tissa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often arranged in pairs along the stems. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits. Tissa teretifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
